results.title: The Gifted ones. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: The gifted child, whose advanced mind distinguishes him from others of his age, is a valuable asset to society. Some say gifted children should be taught in a class of their own. Others say that the average classroom is better for them. The film presents the views of two prominent educators: Dr Florence Dunlop, Ottawa, and Dr. T.W. Martin, Toronto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane

results.title: The Gifted child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Can you multiply 65x65 in your head? Do you know what chromosomes are? A seven year old child answers both these questions in a few seconds at the beginning of this film. This film investigates new research into the ways children think and use their imagination, and also new techniques of education.

results.title: The Gift
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jodine Stodart and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2005, Jodine Stodart travelled to Oxfam Australia to India. It was there that she met a unique lady, not much older than herself, that would leave a lasting impression on the young traveller.

results.title: The Giants
results.creator_credit: Zdenka Deitchova, Kratky Film and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A satirical cartoon film which exposes and ridicules in allegorical form, human intolerance, malice, cowardice and irresponsibility. Intended as a protest against violence and despotism.

results.title: The Giant radio telescope
results.brief_description: A. C. B. Lovell (professor of radio astronomy, University of Manchester) is interviewed about the new giant radio telescope at Jodrell Bank. This historic film was shot in the early years of radio astronomy and the Jodrell Bank telescope was one of the most advanced of its kind. Lovell would later play a key figure in the space race over the next few years, aiding the Soviet Union in tracking cosmonaughtical space programs.

results.title: The Ghost train
results.creator_credit: Edward Black, Gainsborough Pictures, Gaumont and Walter Forde
results.brief_description: Tales of ghosts and things that go bump in the night feature in this British comedy thriller about a phantom train and a group of travellers stranded overnight in the waiting room of a small Cornish junction station. Stars Arthur Askey along with Richard Murdoch, Kathleen Harrison, Peter Murray-Hill, Carole Lynne and Morland Graham. Based on the play by Arnold Ridley.
